related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised**:

* The issue was initially triaged by the Pieces-support-bot and routed to the appropriate team member.
* The user, ekuznetsov139, reported encountering the error "Ollama failed to install" while using Pieces-os, which is installed as a snap on Ubuntu.
* The issue persists even with curl installed, highlighting the problem of restricted access to external tools within the snap environment.

**Problems Identified**:

* Pieces-os snap lacks the curl dependency required for LLM download.
* Sandboxed environment prevents execution of external tools like ollama.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions**:

* Patch developed to allow ollama usage within the Pieces-os snap environment.
* Infrastructure updates completed to prioritize fixing the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome**:

* The fix is currently on a branch and is expected to be rolled out in the next week.
* Inference as well as downloading remain impacted until the fix is implemented.

**Additional Notes**:

* The user, cwoolfo1, inquired about the progress of the fix and potential workarounds.
* Brian-at-pieces responded with an update confirming the completion of infrastructure updates and resumption of work on the fix.
* Further updates will likely be provided by the Pieces team once the fix is complete and included in a new release.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: PiecesOS Memory & CPU Usage

**Key points raised:**

* High memory and CPU usage by PiecesOS, impacting user experience and performance.
* Memory usage exceeding 2GB, even with no models installed or running.
* Concerns about potential mining activity by the software.
* High CPU spikes causing system slowdowns.

**Problems identified:**

* Memory leak causing high memory usage.
* Possible lack of optimization for on-device ML capabilities.
* Issues with Live Context feature and Workstream Pattern Engine.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* "Optimize Memory" feature to unload unused ML models.
* Replacement of two heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0.
* Ongoing work on additional fixes to improve memory and CPU usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 released with improvements to memory and CPU usage.
* Community feedback is being monitored to assess the effectiveness of the fixes.
* Further improvements planned for the future.

**Additional Notes:**

* Live Context feature may contribute to higher memory usage.
* Turning off the Live Context feature can help reduce memory consumption.
* Community members are encouraged to share their experiences and provide feedback.

Please note that this is a summary of the conversation up until November 2023, and there may have been further updates or changes since then.

common_issues.description: Users reported Pieces Desktop app failing to launch or update, particularly after a Pieces OS upgrade or when installed via Microsoft Store. related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Conversation Summary: 

**Problem:** ThemePark's Pieces Desktop app wouldn't open after upgrading to PiecesOS 11.0 on Windows 10.

**Key Points:**
* ThemePark confirmed having both Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop installed.
* Mack at Pieces suspected a launch timing conflict between PiecesOS and Desktop app upon system restart.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack suggested identifying the app set to launch on Startup (PiecesOS or Desktop).
* ThemePark confirmed having PiecesOS app set to launch at Startup.
* Two proposed remedies included:
    * Switching the Startup app to Pieces Desktop instead.
    * Disabling both apps from automatically launching on Startup. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* ThemePark was awaiting Mack's recommendation on the best solution to avoid the launch conflict. 


##  Overall Summary: 
The Pieces support team was investigating  an issue where ThemePark's Pieces Desktop app wouldn't launch after  a PiecesOS 11.0 upgrade. The cause is suspected to be  a startup timing conflict  between PiecesOS and Desktop app on  ThemePark's Windows 10 system.  Mack has proposed disabling startup launch for one of  apps to resolve the conflict while awaiting ThemePark's response on their  preferred remedy

* Raju-git20 is experiencing issues connecting to PiecesOS.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate team member.
* Raju-git20 is trying to connect to PiecesOS using Python code for scraping LinkedIn positions.

* Raju-git20 was initially using the wrong port (54321) instead of the new port (39300).
* Even with the correct port, Raju-git20 is still unable to connect.

* Raju-git20's project involves scraping LinkedIn positions and applying to them using AI, which is outside the scope of the PiecesOS support team.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Integration Issues:** Allocate resources to address the recurring problem of Ollama installation failures within Pieces OS, particularly on Linux and Windows. Investigate dependency conflicts, sandbox restrictions, and implement necessary patches to ensure seamless Ollama functionality.

**Improve PiecesOS Linux App Stability:** Address reported issues with the Linux app, including font customization limitations, high resource consumption, and Ollama installation failures. Implement UI updates for font control, optimize memory usage, and enable smoother external tool access within the snap environment.

**Resolve Pieces Desktop App Launch and Update Issues:** Investigate and fix problems related to the Desktop app failing to launch or update, especially after a Pieces OS upgrade or when installed via the Microsoft Store. Address startup conflicts, improve update mechanisms, and provide clear guidance to users experiencing these issues.

**Provide Clear Guidance on Pieces OS Connection Issues:** Create comprehensive documentation or FAQs addressing connection issues with Pieces OS, specifically regarding port configurations. Explain the port-finding algorithm, common error messages (like ECONNREFUSED), and potential firewall issues.

**Gather More Data on Performance Issues:** While some users reported high RAM/CPU usage, more data is needed. Implement better logging and error reporting for performance issues to help developers identify the root causes and implement effective solutions.

**Improve Communication on Update Processes:** Clearly communicate to users the differences between installing Pieces OS via the website and the Microsoft Store, particularly regarding the update process. Provide timely updates on the progress of improvements to the update functionality for Microsoft Store installations.

**Proactively Monitor Common Issues:** Develop a system to proactively monitor and identify recurring issues across different platforms. This could involve analyzing support tickets, community forums, and social media for emerging trends and common pain points.
